AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States/Mexican Border Patrol: conducted a roving stop of the large white Ford pickup truck and patrols a 140-mile area of the United States/Mexican border, involved in surveillance and pursuit of suspicious vehicles, conducted a stop, makes temporary investigative stops based on reasonable suspicion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Big Bend National Park: national park located on the United States/Mexican border where vehicle sensors are located, source of tourist traffic, location where a suspicious work vehicle was seen, possible transit point for smugglers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marfa Sector Area Operations Center: operations center for Border Patrol activities that notified agents about vehicle sensor activations
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country with shared border with Mexico
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.District Court: court that denied the motion to suppress, analyzes reasonable suspicion in border patrol stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States/Mexican border: geographic location relevant to the case, proximity to which may contribute to reasonable suspicion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.5th Circuit Court: court that established guidelines for reasonable suspicion in border patrol stops
